item.title: Ezekiel 1
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 1

1The fifth day, fourth month, thirtieth year, I was by the Chebar River with the exiles. The sky opened up, and I saw a vision of God. (2The fifth month, fifth year of Jehoiachin’s exile, 3God’s message came to Ezekiel, and God’s hand came on him.) 4A strong north wind was blowing, and a large cloud with a bright glow around it flashed constantly with lightning. In the cloud was something like glowing metal 5and four figures like living beings with human forms. 6Each one had four faces and four wings. 7They had straight legs, and their feet resembled calf hooves that shined like polished bronze. 8There were hands under their wings, 9and the wings of all four touched each other. Their faces didn’t turn as they moved straight forward. 10Each one had the faces of a man, an eagle, a lion on the right, and a bull on the left. 11Their wings spread out above them, two wings touching the wings of the next living beings and two covering their bodies. 12They went straight forward wherever the spirit went, without turning as they went. 13Among the beings were what looked like burning coals, like torches moving back and forth. The fire burned bright, and lightning kept flashing out of it. 14The living beings darted back forth like bolts of lightning.

item.title: Ezekiel 2
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 2

1“Son of man, stand up so I can talk to you!” 2When the Spirit stood me up, 3he said, “I’m sending you to the Israelites, a rebellious people. They and their ancestors have been sinning against me to this day. 4Tell those impudent, stubborn children, ‘The Lord Yahveh says.’ 5Whether they listen or not, they’ll know a prophet’s been there. 6Don’t be afraid of them or intimidated by what they say, though you’re surrounded by briars and thorns and sitting on scorpions. 7Tell them what I’ve said whether they listen or not.

item.title: Ezekiel 4
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 4

1“Now, son of man, take a tablet and etch Jerusalem on it. 2Lay a siege against it with a siege wall and ramp, pitch camps, and position battering rams all around it. 3Then set up an iron plate as a wall between you and the city. Face it and press the siege against it. It’s an omen for Israel. 4“Lie down on your left side, and I’ll lay Israel’s punishment on you. You’ll bear their punishment for the number of days you lie on it. 5Lie like that one day for each of

item.title: Ezekiel 5
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 5

1“Son of man, take a sharp sword and shave off your hair and beard. Divide up the hair on a scales. 2Burn a third of it in the center of the city when the siege is over. Strike a third of it with a sword all around the city. Scatter another third of it in the wind, because I’m going to chase my people with a drawn sword. 3Attach a few to the hem of your robe. 4Throw a few in the fire. They’ll spread from the fire to the whole House of Israel. 5I’ve set Jerusalem in the center of the nations. 6It rebelled against my ordinances and statutes more than those other nations did.”

item.title: Ezekiel 6
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 6

1A message from Yahveh came to me: 2“Son of man, face Israel’s mountains and prophesy, 3‘Listen to the Lord Yahveh’s message to the mountains and hills, ravines and valleys: “I’m going to bring a sword against you and destroy your high places. 4Your altars will be demolished and your incense altars smashed. You’ll fall slain in front of your idols, 5and I’ll scatter your bones around your altars. 6Everywhere you live, towns will be waste, high places desolate, idols broken, incense altars cut down, and the religious objects you’ve made, destroyed. 7You’ll know I’m Yahveh. 8“But I’ll leave a few of you. Some will escape the sword in the nations where you scatter. 9You’ll think back to me where they take you captive—how you’ve hurt me with your adulterous hearts and with eyes that carried on prostitution with idols. You’ll abhor yourselves for those detestable deeds. 10You’ll know I’m Yahveh, that I meant it when I said I’d inflict you with this disaster.”’

item.title: Ezekiel 7
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 7

1A message from Yahveh came to me: 2“Son of man, the Lord Yahveh says to Israel, ‘The end is coming on the four corners of your land. 3I’ll judge you by your ways, direct my anger at you, and bring your detestable things against you. 4I won’t pity or spare when I bring on you the consequences of your deeds with the detestable things you’ve used.’ 5A disaster—a unique disaster—is coming! 6The end is here! It has awakened against you! 7You’re doomed, resident in the land—confusion instead of happy shouting on the mountains. [8] 9You’ll know that I Yahveh am striking you. 10“The rod has budded, arrogance has blossomed, 11violence has grown into a rod of sinfulness. Nothing will remain of their multitude, their wealth, or anything outstanding that they have. 12The buyer shouldn’t celebrate, the seller shouldn’t mourn, because anger is aimed at their abundance. 13The seller won’t regain what he sold as long as they’re both alive, because the vision about their affluence won’t fade away. Because of his sin, neither will live.

item.title: Ezekiel 8
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 8

1The fifth day, sixth month, sixth year, I was sitting in my house with Judah’s elders sitting in front of me, and the hand of the Lord Yahveh came down on me. 2I saw what looked like a man. From the waist down, he looked like fire; from the waist up, he looked like bright glowing metal. 3He reached out and took hold of my hair. The Spirit lifted me up between earth and sky, and took me in a vision to Jerusalem, to the entrance of the north gate of the inner court, to the seat of the idol that provokes jealousy. 4The glory of Israel’s God was there—like what I’d seen in the plain.

item.title: Ezekiel 9
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 9

1He shouted, “Executioners, come here with your weapons.” 2Six men holding a shattering weapon, came from the direction of the upper gate, which faces north. One of them was wearing linen with a scribe’s inkhorn on his hip. They went in and stood beside the bronze altar.

3The glory of God rose up from the cherub it rested on and went to the threshold of the Temple. He called out to the man with the inkhorn,

item.title: Ezekiel 10
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 10

1Then in the expanse above the cherubs, I saw something like a sapphire stone shaped like a throne. 2He spoke to the man dressed in linen, “Go between the turning wheels under the cherubs and fill your hands with coals. Scatter them over the city.” I watched him go in.

3The cherubs were standing on the right side of the Temple when he went in, and a cloud filled the inner court. 4The glory of Yahveh rose up from the cherubs to the threshold of the Temple. The cloud filled the Temple, and the bright glory of Yahveh filled the court. 5The cherubs’ wings could be heard all the way to the outer court—like God Almighty when he speaks.

item.title: Ezekiel 11
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 11

1The Spirit lifted me up and took me to the east gate of theY Temple. There

were 25

men at the entrance of the gate, including Jaazaniah Ben-Azzur and Pelatiah Ben-Benaiah, leaders of the people. 2He told me, “Those men devise sin and give bad advice in this city. 3They say, ‘Isn’t it time to build houses? This city is the pot and we’re the meat.’ 4So prophesy against them, son of man, prophesy!” Ezek 11:1-4

5The Spirit of Yahveh fell on me: “Say, ‘Yahveh says, “I know your thoughts. 6You’ve multiplied the slain in this city and filled its streets with them. 7‘So the slain are the meat, and the city is the pot; but I’ll take you out of it. 8You’ve been afraid of the sword; so I’ll bring the sword on you. 9I’ll remove you from the city and deliver you to foreigners to carry out your condemnation. 10You’ll fall by the sword all the way to Israel’s border. 11This city won’t be a pot for you, and you won’t be the meat in it. 12You’ll know I’m Yahveh because you haven’t followed my statutes or carried out my ordinances. You’ve followed the ordinances of the nations around you.”’”

item.title: Ezekiel 12
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 12

1A message from Yahveh came to me: 2“Son of man, you’re living with a rebellious people. They have eyes but don’t see, and ears but don’t hear. 3So get together baggage for exile and go into exile in the daytime so they can watch; go from one place to another. Maybe they’ll understand, though they’re a rebellious house. 4Bring your baggage out in the daytime. Then go out in the evening as if you’re going into exile. 5Make a hole in the wall so they can watch you go out through it.

item.title: Ezekiel 13
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 13

1A message from Yahveh came to me: 2“Son of man, prophesy against Israel’s prophets who prophesy their own ideas, 3‘The Lord Yahveh says, “Misfortune awaits foolish prophets that follow their own imagination and haven’t seen anything. 4Israel, your prophets have been like foxes among ruins. 5You haven’t gone up into the breaches or built the wall around the House of Israel to stand in the battle in the day of Yahveh. 6They see falsehood and lying fortunetelling who say, ‘Yahveh says,’ when heY hasn’t sent them. They’re just hoping their message will be what happens. 7Didn’t you see a false vision and say a lying fortunetelling when you said, ‘Yahveh says’? I’m not the one that spoke.”’”

item.title: Ezekiel 14
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 14

1Then some elders of Israel came and sat down in front of me. 2A message from Yahveh came to me: 3“Son of man, these people have set up idols in their hearts, and put their sins in front of them to trip over. Should they consult me? 4So tell them, ‘The Lord Yahveh says, “If any Israelites or immigrants in Israel set up idols in their heart, put their sin in front of him to trip over, and then come to a prophet to inquire from me, I’ll answer them myself because of their many idols. 5I’ll do it to lay hold of the hearts in Israel that are alienated from me by their idols.”’

item.title: Ezekiel 15
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 15

1A message from Yahveh came to me: 2“Son of man, how does the wood in a grapevine compare to the wood in a tree limb? 3Can you make anything out of grapevine wood, say, a peg to hang a bucket on? 4If it’s been put in the fire for fuel, is burned on both ends and charred in the middle, can you make anything out of it? 5If it’s intact and you can’t make it into anything, how much less when fire has burned and charred it.” 6So the Lord Yahveh says, “Like grapevine wood that I’ve put in the fire for fuel, I’ve given up the people in Jerusalem. 7Though they’ve come out of the fire, it’s charred them. You’ll know I’m Yahveh when I set myself against them. 8I’ll make the country desolate because they’ve been unfaithful.”

item.title: Ezekiel 16
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 16

1A message from Yahveh came to me: 2“Son of man, confront Jerusalem about her detestable things. 3Say, ‘Your birth was from the Canaanites—an Amorite father and a Hittite mother. 4When you were born, your umbilical cord wasn’t cut off, you weren’t washed, or rubbed with salt, or even wrapped in cloth. 5Nobody took pity on you to do any of those things for you. You were tossed out in an open field because you were repulsive.

item.title: Ezekiel 17
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 17

1A message from Yahveh came to me: 2“Son of man, tell Israel this parable. 3‘A large eagle with big wings, long pinions, and full plumage of many colors flew to Lebanon and plucked off 4the top of a cedar tree. He took it to a land filled with merchants and planted it in a city full of tradesmen. 5He also took a seedling from the land and planted it in fertile soil, like a willow beside a stream. 6It took root and became a low, spreading vine with branches turned upward toward the eagle and roots growing down into the soil. It put out shoots and grew branches.

item.title: Ezekiel 18
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 18

1A message from Yahveh came to me: 2“What do you mean by the proverb about Israel, ‘The parents ate sour grapes, and the children’s mouths puckered’?

3As I live, you’re not going to use that proverb in Israel anymore. 4Every soul belongs to me, the parent’s as well as the children’s. The soul that sins is the one that dies. 5“If a man practices goodness,

item.title: Ezekiel 19
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 19

1“Sing this funeral song for Israel’s officials: 2‘What was your mother? A lioness among lions! She lay down among young lions; she raised her cubs.

3When she brought up one of her cubs, he became a young lion, learned to catch prey, and devoured people.

Ezek 19:1-3

4Then nations heard about him. They captured him in their pit, and brought him with hooks to Egypt.

item.title: Ezekiel 20
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 20

1The tenth day, fifth month, seventh year, some of Israel’s elders came to inquire from Yahveh and sat in front of me. 2A message from him came to me: 3“Son of man, tell Israel’s elders the Lord Yahveh says, ‘Are you coming to inquire from me? As I live, I won’t let you.’ 4“Are you willing to judge them, son of man? Then remind them about their ancestors’ detestable deeds. 5Tell them that when I chose Israel, swore to Jacob’s descendants, and made myself known to them in Egypt,6I swore I’d take them out of Egypt to a land I’d chosen, a land flowing with milk and honey, the most beautiful of all the lands. 7I told them to throw away the detestable things their eyes feasted on and not defile themselves with Egypt’s idols. I’m Yahveh their God. 8But they wouldn’t discard them.

item.title: Ezekiel 21
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 21

1A message from Yahveh came to me: 2“Son of man, face Jerusalem. Speak against its sanctuaries and prophesy against Israel, 3‘Yahveh says, “I’ll draw my sword and slay the good and the bad in you, 4everybody from south to north. 5Everyone will know I’ve drawn it, and it won’t go back into its sheath.”’ 6“Son of man, moan with breaking heart and bitter grief. 7When they ask why you’re moaning, say, ‘Over the news that’s coming. Hearts will melt, hands will go limp, spirits will faint, knees will be as weak as water.’”

item.title: Ezekiel 22
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 22

1A message from Yahveh came to me: 2“Son of man, are you willing to judge the bloody city? Then tell it about its abominations. 3Say, ‘The Lord Yahveh says, “A city that sheds blood in it, a city whose time will come, a city that makes idols to defile itself! 4-5You’ve become guilty by shedding blood and defiled by making idols. You’ve brought your appointed time near, you infamous one full of turmoil; I’ve made you a disgrace to nations near and far, something to ridicule.

item.title: Ezekiel 23
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 23

1A message from Yahveh came to me: 2“Son of man, there were two women, daughters of the same mother. 3They carried on prostitution in Egypt when they were young. Their breasts were pressed there and their virgin bosom was handled. 4Their names were Oholah the older and Oholibah her sister. They became mine and had children. Samaria is Oholah; Jerusalem is Oholibah. 5“Oholah played the prostitute while she belonged to me, and doted on her lovers, the Assyrians, her neighbors, 6who dressed in purple, governors and officials, all of them desirable young men, horsemen riding on their horses. 7She bestowed her prostitution on them, choice men of Assyria. She defiled herself with their idols. 8She didn’t abandon her prostitution from the time she was in Egypt. When she was young, men had lain with her, and handled her virgin bosom and poured out their lust on her. 9So I gave her to her lovers, the Assyrians. 10They uncovered her nakedness; they took her children but killed her with a sword. So she became a byword among women, and they carried out judgments on her.

item.title: Ezekiel 24
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 24

1The tenth day, tenth month, ninth year, a message from Yahveh came to me: 2“Son of man, write down the date. The king of Babylon laid siege to Jerusalem today. 3Tell the rebellious people a parable, ‘The Lord Yahveh says, “Put a pot on and pour water in it;

4 4put good pieces in it, thigh and shoulder; fill it with choice bones.

5Take the best of the flock, and put wood under the pot. Boil it hard; seethe its bones with the meat.”

item.title: Ezekiel 25
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 25

1A message from Yahveh came to me: 2“Face the Ammonites and prophesy against them, 3’Because you said, “Ha!” at my sanctuary when it was profaned, and at Israel when it became a wasteland, and at Judah when they went into exile, 4I’m going to turn you over to the people from the east. They’ll set up their camps among you and live there, eat your fruit and drink your milk. 5I’ll make Rabbah into a pasture for camels and the Ammonites a resting place for flocks. 6Because you clapped your hands and stamped your feet and celebrated with scorn at Israel, 7I’ll give you to the nations for spoil, cut you off from the peoples, and make you perish from the land so you’ll know I’m Yahveh.’

item.title: Ezekiel 26
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 26

1The first day of the month, eleventh year, a message from Yahveh came to me: 2“Son of man, Tyre has said about Jerusalem, ‘Ha! its gate’s broken; it has swung open to me. I’ll be filled now that it’s laid waste.’ 3But the Lord Yahveh says, ‘I’ll bring nations against you, Tyre, like waves in the sea. 4They’ll destroy your walls and tear down your towers. I’ll scrape away the rubble and make you a bare rock, 5a place for spreading nets by the sea. I’ve spoken: you’ll become spoil for the nations, 6and your inhabitants on the mainland will die by the sword. You’ll know I’m Yahveh.’”

item.title: Ezekiel 27
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 27

1A message from Yahveh came to me: 2“Son of man, take up a lamentation over Tyre 3that sits at the port to the sea, the nations’ merchant to many ports, The Lord Yahveh says, ‘Tyre, you’ve said “I’m perfectly beautiful.”

4Your borders extend into the heart of the sea; your builders have perfected your beauty.

5They’ve made your planks out of fir trees from Seir; they’ve taken a cedar from Lebanon to make a mast for you.

item.title: Ezekiel 28
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 28

1A message from Yahveh came to me again: 2“Son of man, tell the leader of Tyre; ‘The Lord Yahveh says, “You’re arrogant; you’ve said, ‘I’m a god; I sit in God’s seat in the heart of the sea.’ But you’re a mortal, not God, though you exalt yourself as if you were God. (3You think you’re wiser than Daniel, that no secret is a match for you.

item.title: Ezekiel 29
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 29

1The twelfth day, tenth month, tenth year, a message from Yahveh came to me: 2“Son of man, turn toward Pharaoh, Egypt’s king, and prophesy against him and Egypt. 3’The Lord Yahveh says, “I’m against you, Pharaoh Egypt’s king, the big crocodile that lies in your streams, that has said, ‘My Nile belongs to me; I made it.’

4I’ll put hooks in your jaws, and make the fish in your streams stick to your scales. I’ll drag you out on your shore with fish clinging to your scales.

item.title: Ezekiel 30
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 30

1A message from Yahveh came to me again: 2“Son of man, prophesy, ‘The Lord Yahveh says, “Wail, ‘Oh for the day!’

3The day of Yahveh is near, a cloudy day of doom for the nations.

4A sword will come at Egypt; there’ll be anguish in Nubia when the slain fall in Egypt. They’ll carry away its wealth and tear up its foundations.

item.title: Ezekiel 31
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 31

1The first day, third month, eleventh year, a message from Yahveh came to me: 2“Son of man, tell Pharaoh and his large host, ‘Who is as great as you?

3Assyria was a cedar in Lebanon with beautiful branches and forest shade and its top in the clouds.

4The water made it grow, the underground water made it tall; rivers continually flowed where it was planted; it sent out its channels to all the trees.

item.title: Ezekiel 32
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 32

1The first day, twelfth month, twelfth year, a message from Yahveh came to me: 2“Son of man, raise a lamentation over Pharaoh, Egypt’s king. Tell him, ‘You consider yourself a young lion among the nations, but you’re like a sea monster in the ocean. You splash around in your rivers, stir up the water with your feet, and muddy the rivers.’”

3The Lord Yahveh says, “I’ll cast my net over you along with a host of nations; they’ll haul you up from the water.

item.title: Ezekiel 33
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 33

1A message from Yahveh came to me: 2“Tell your people, ‘If I bring the sword on a country, and the people’s watchman 3blows the ram’s horn to warn them—4then those who don’t pay attention are responsible for their own death. 5If they’d taken warning, they would’ve saved their life. 6If the watchman sees the sword coming and doesn’t warn the people, if the sword takes some people, they’ll be taken away in their sin, but I’ll hold the watchman responsible for it.’ 7“Son of man, I’ve made you a watchman for Israel so you’ll hear a message from me to warn them. 8When I tell sinful people they’re going to die, but you don’t warn them, they’ll die in their sin, but I’ll hold you responsible for it. 9But if you warn them and they don’t turn from your way, they’ll die in their sin, but you’ve saved your life.

item.title: Ezekiel 34
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 34

1A message from Yahveh came to me: 2“Son of man, prophesy against Israel’s shepherds. ‘The Lord Yahveh says, “Misfortune awaits you, shepherds that feed yourselves! Shouldn’t shepherds feed the flock? 3You eat the healthy and dress with their wool. You slaughter the healthy sheep without feeding the flock. 4You don’t strengthen the sickly, heal the diseased, bandage up the crippled, bring back the scattered, or look for the lost. With force and severity, you bully them. 5They’re scattered all over the world because they didn’t have a shepherd; they became prey for wild animals. 6My flock wandered around in the mountains and tall hills; nobody looked for them.

item.title: Ezekiel 35
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 35

1A message from the Lord came to me: 2“Son of man, face Mount Seir and prophesy against it, 3‘The Lord Yahveh says, “I’m against you, Mount Seir; I’ll make you a wasteland.

4I’ll lay your towns waste, and you’ll be desolate. You’ll know I’m Yahveh.

5In your endless enmity, you delivered Israel to the sword at the time of its catastrophe, its final punishment. 6So as I live, I’ll deliver you to bloodshed. Since you haven’t despised bloodshed, it’ll pursue you. 7I’ll make Mount Seir a waste and slay everyone that tries to escape or return there. 8I’ll fill its mountains with the dead. They’ll fall in its hills, valleys, and ravines. 9I’ll make it a permanent wasteland and its towns uninhabited. It will know I’m Yahveh.

item.title: Ezekiel 36
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 36

1“Son of man, prophesy to the mountains of Israel, ‘Listen to 2what the Lord Yahveh says, “Your enemy has ridiculed you, ‘Ha!’ and ‘The everlasting mountains are ours now!’” 3So prophesy, ‘For good reason other nations made you desolate and crushed you from every direction, took possession of you, and mocked and whispered.’” 4‘So, mountains of Israel, listen to the message from the Lord Yahveh to the mountains and hills, ravines and valleys, desolate wastes and abandoned towns that have become prey and objects of derision. 5“In my burning jealousy, I’ve spoken against those nations, particularly Edom that took over my land with wholehearted joy and scornful attitude. I’ve sworn to drive it out to become prey. 6So prophesy to Israel’s mountains and hills, ravines and valleys, “I’ve spoken in my anger because you’ve had to endure insults from other nations. 7I swear they will endure insults.’”

item.title: Ezekiel 37
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 37

-2Yahveh’s hand was on me. He took me out in spirit and put me down in a valley full of dry bones, 2and had me walk around among them. 3“Son of man, can these bones come alive?” “Lord Yahveh, you know.” 4“Prophesy over them, ‘Dry bones, listen to Yahveh. 5I’ll put breath in you so you can come to life. 6I’ll put sinews on you, make flesh grow back, and cover you with skin. You’ll know I’m Yahveh.’”

item.title: Ezekiel 38
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 38

1A message from Yahveh came to me: 2“Son of man, face Gog of the land of Magog, the prince that rules Meshech and Tubal, and prophesy against him, 3‘The Lord Yahveh says, “I’m against you, Gog. 4I’ll turn you around, put hooks in your jaws, and take you out—you, your army, horses and horsemen, all splendidly attired, a large army with buckler and shield, wielding swords; 5Persia, Nubia, and Put with them, all with shield and helmet; 6Gomer with all its troops; Beth-togarmah from the remote parts of the north with all its troops—many nations with you. 7“Be prepared, you and the armies allied with you as their commander. 8After a long time you’ll be drawn to a land restored from the sword, whose residents live safely. They will have gathered from many nations to the mountains in Israel, which had been a continual waste. 9You and your troops will come down on them like a storm, like a cloud over the land.”

item.title: Ezekiel 39
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 39

1“Son of man, prophesy against Gog, ‘The Lord Yahveh says, “I’m against you, ruler of Meshech, and Tubal. 2I’ll turn you around, drive you on, take you up from the most remote parts in the north, and bring you against Israel. 3I’ll knock the bow out of your left hand, and the arrows out of your right hand. 4-5You and your troops will fall on the mountains in Israel. I’ll feed you to every vulture and wild animal in the open country. I’ve said so. 6I’ll rain down fire on Magog and those who live securely in distant lands. They’ll know I’m Yahveh.’

item.title: Ezekiel 40
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 40

1At the beginning of the twenty-fifth year of our exile, the tenth month, fourteenth year after the city fell, Yahveh’s hand weighed heavy on me. 2In visions he took me to Israel and set me on a tall mountain. On it to the south was a structure like a city. 3He took me over there. Standing in the gate was a bronze-looking man with a flax line and a measuring rod in his hand. 4He told me, “Son of man, look, listen, pay attention to everything I show you. That’s why Yahveh brought you here. Tell Israel everything you see.”

item.title: Ezekiel 41
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 41

1Then he took me to the nave and measured the side pillars. Each pillar

was 10

’ 4" 6 cubits square. 2The entrance was 17’ 3" 10 cubits wide; the sides of the entrance were 8’ 7" 3 cubits on each side. He measured the length and width of the nave at 69’ x 34’ 6" 40 x 20 cubits. 3He went inside and measured each side pillar of the doorway at 3’ 5" 2 cubits, and the doorway at 6’ 10" high and 12’ 1" wide 6h x 7w cubits. 4He measured the front of the nave at 34’ 6" 20 cubits square He told me, “This is the Holy Place.” Ezek 41:1-4

5He measured the Temple wall

item.title: Ezekiel 42
item.description:
Ezekiel Chapter 42

1Then he took me north to the outer court, to the rooms across from the Temple yard and the north building. 2The length of the building on the north side

was 172

’ 5" x 86’ 3" 50 x 100 cubits. 3Beside the 34’ 6" 20 cubits that belonged to the inner court and facing the pavement of the outer court, there was a three-story gallery. 4In front of its rooms was an inner walkway 17’ 3" wide x 172’ 5" long 10 x 100lcubits with doorways on the north. 5The upper rooms were narrower, because the galleries took more space away from them than from the lower and middle floors of the building. 6The rooms had three stories and didn’t have any pillars like the pillars in the courts. So the upper rooms were set back more than the lower two levels. 7The outer wall beside the rooms toward the court was 86’ 3" 50 cubits long. 8The rooms in the outer court were 86’ 3" 50 cubits long. The rooms facing the Temple were 172’ 5" 100 cubits long. 9Below those rooms, was the east entrance as you enter them from the outer court, where the outside wall begins. Ezek 42:1-9

10On the east across from the yard and the building there were rooms 11with a passage in front of them. They were like the rooms on the north with the same length and width and with the same exits, arrangements, and doors. 12Below the south rooms, there was an entrance on the east side—where a person goes into the passage—and across from them there was a dividing wall.

item.title: Ezekiel 43
